newsitem.title: JAPAN: Sharp, Alcatel develop mobile communication device.
newsitem.headline: Sharp, Alcatel develop mobile communication device.

text.p: Sharp Corp said on Thursday that it and French communication systems maker Alcatel Alsthom have jointly developed new mobile communications equipment that incorporates a cellular phone.
The new product, Personal Mobile Communicator (PMC), is expected to be launched in Europe in the autumn of this year, the company said in a statement.
While the PMC can be used as a cell phone, it can also gain access to workstations and personal computers and allow exchanges of e-mail, the statement said.
The new product is based on the Global System for Mobile Communication (GSM), which was launched as the European digital cellular standard in 1992, it said.
